content:
• Friday, March 15, 2013
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) +3.6% AH after disclosing in an 8-K filing a restatement of Q1,...

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) +3.6% AH after disclosing in an 8-K filing a restatement of Q1, Q2 and Q3 results from 2012 due to derivatives previously recognized as hedges increased 2012 net income by $133M to reflect changes in fair value in earnings. KWK discontinued the use of hedge accounting on all its derivatives effective Dec. 31, 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) +3.1% AH as AB InBev (NYSE:BUD), Grupo Modelo and the Justice...

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) +3.1% AH as AB InBev (NYSE:BUD), Grupo Modelo and the Justice Department ask a federal court to allow more time for settlement talks that could resolve a government lawsuit challenging the companies' planned merger. After DoJ sued to stop the deal, BUD agreed to sell a Modelo brewery in Mexico to STZ for $2.9B and grant STZ perpetual rights for Corona and other Modelo brands in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • ULTR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ULTR +9%. AKG +9%. BCEI +9%. WAL +4%. KWK +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ULTR +9%. AKG +9%. BCEI +9%. WAL +4%. KWK +4%.
    After-hours top losers: YONG -5%. YGE -4%. TRX -4%. LFL -4%. NSU -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYNM

    Syntroleum (NASDAQ:SYNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.1M in-line. Shares...

    Syntroleum (NASDAQ:SYNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.1M in-line. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +4.5%) rallies again today on continued momentum from Tuesday's news...

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +4.5%) rallies again today on continued momentum from Tuesday's news that it had sold a 175-kilowatt ClearGen fuel cell system to Azure Hydrogen Energy Science and Technology Corporation of Beijing, China, and Wednesday's announcement of the sale of fuel cell modules to power a fleet of 10 clean energy buses in Aberdeen, Scotland.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -12.2%) is the day's worst energy performer after Q4 earnings and revenues...

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -12.2%) is the day's worst energy performer after Q4 earnings and revenues missed analyst estimates, hurt in part by lower selling prices of crude oil and natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +0.9%) moves up today on a better than expected Q4 report yesterday, largely...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +0.9%) moves up today on a better than expected Q4 report yesterday, largely shrugging off Cantor Fitzgerald's slashing of its price target to $4.00 from $11.00. The cut relates to ONTY's loss of Stimuvax. Cantor says that despite partner Merck's (NYSE:MRK) assertion that treatment effects were observed in sub-populations, its financial model assumes that commercialization does not occur and no value is included in its valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • CNP

    CenterPoint (CNP +7.8%) and OGE Energy (OGE +10%) both hit multiyear highs on plans to...

    CenterPoint (CNP +7.8%) and OGE Energy (OGE +10%) both hit multiyear highs on plans to combine pipeline and related assets into an MLP, providing a source of capital as they take advantage of oil and gas demand. The deal could pave the way for other utilities to follow suit; Tudor Pickering sees Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE), Dominion Resources (NYSE:D) and NiSource (NYSE:NI) as candidates to form similar partnerships.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • PGNX

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (PGNX +30%) soars after reporting Q4 losses narrowed to $0.01 per...

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (PGNX +30%) soars after reporting Q4 losses narrowed to $0.01 per share, compared with the prior-year period's loss of $0.32 per share. Revenues also jumped to $8.9M, up from $2.3M in the same period last year, and above analysts estimates of $1.16M. The company attributes the boost in sales from partnering two of its proprietary research programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources' (ROSE +1%) purchase of some of Comstock Resources' (CRK +13.6%) oil-rich...

    Rosetta Resources' (ROSE +1%) purchase of some of Comstock Resources' (CRK +13.6%) oil-rich acreage in the Permian Basin will reduce its dependence on the Eagle Ford shale and "provides clarity on growth plans"; ~96% of ROSE's production last year came from Eagle Ford. Shares of other firms with prominent Permian acreage also are higher: CWEI +10%, XEC +1%, CXO +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • AMAG

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +3%) moves up after reporting positive preliminary data from its...

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +3%) moves up after reporting positive preliminary data from its IDA-303 study evaluating the safety and efficacy of repeat dosing using ferumoxytol in patients with persistent or recurring iron deficiency anemia. The study showed that 151 patients who received their first course of therapy in IDA-303, achieved statistically significant mean increase in hemoglobin from baseline, which was the study's primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +6.9%) says its rig utilization rose to 71% in February vs. 67% in...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +6.9%) says its rig utilization rose to 71% in February vs. 67% in January and 76% a year ago, despite snow, wind and ice interruptions at its mid-continent and Permian Basin operations. BAS also expects customer spending to improve. SunTrust says the latest jump in natural gas prices also could help BAS.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +4.7%) trades up after Credit Suisse raises the shares to...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +4.7%) trades up after Credit Suisse raises the shares to Outperform and raised its price target to $24 from $15. The firm says IRWD is poised to see strong demand for its IBS drug Linzess, based on a survey of 100 physicians.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -1.3%) slips on a less-than-stellar initiation at Credit Suisse...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -1.3%) slips on a less-than-stellar initiation at Credit Suisse with a Neutral rating and a $52 price target. The firm says it expects that positive CXA-201 data in the second half will strengthen confidence in the long-term sustainability of it's antibiotic franchise and be the impetus for global expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME -3.8%) suffers a bout of profit-taking today after its Q4 beat on a per...

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME -3.8%) suffers a bout of profit-taking today after its Q4 beat on a per share basis but came up far short on revenue as total sales plummeted 75% Y/Y. Net income was $7.7M , as compared to a net loss of $5.9M for Q411, with the increase largely due to an $11.2M gain on the settlement of debt owed to Merck.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • GLUU

    Believe it or not, a heavy short interest and the words "online gambling" can fuel a big rally...

    Believe it or not, a heavy short interest and the words "online gambling" can fuel a big rally in a small-cap stock. Glu Mobile (GLUU +11.5%) is soaring today on volume that's already over 3x its daily average, and is now up 34% since it announced plans to launch a mobile slot game in partnership with U.K. online gambling firm Probability. 23.1% of the float was shorted as of Feb. 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 6 Comments
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS -2.8%) slumps following a Neutral coverage launch from Sidoti, which has set a...

    Stratasys (SSYS -2.8%) slumps following a Neutral coverage launch from Sidoti, which has set a $76 PT. 3D Systems (DDD -4.4%), meanwhile, is adding to the losses it saw yesterday following news CTO/co-founder Charles Hull unloaded over half his stake. Also lower: PRLB -3.5%. XONE -2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR -4%) adds to the big losses it saw on Wednesday in response to its soft 2013 guidance...

    MEMC (WFR -4%) adds to the big losses it saw on Wednesday in response to its soft 2013 guidance after Jefferies slashes its PT to $4 from $4.50. Declaring MEMC's solar system business "a 2014+ story," the firm expects shares to be range-bound, with chip industry trends determining their fate. Goldman provided a more positive take yesterday, forecasting "a robust 2H13 buoyed by cyclical strength in semis."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -5.5%) continues its fall again today, adding further downside to...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -5.5%) continues its fall again today, adding further downside to yesterday's selloff after the American Congress of OB/GYNs questioned the cost-benefit of using robotic devices for hysterectomy surgeries. In late February, it was reported that the FDA was scrutinizing an increase in reports of complications using ISRG's da Vinci surgical robot.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • EDU

    Shares of New Oriental Education (EDU +8.5%) jet higher with chatter circulating around that the...

    Shares of New Oriental Education (EDU +8.5%) jet higher with chatter circulating around that the company is the subject of takeover interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +6.6%) shrug off this week's downgrade from Goldman Sachs to poke out...

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +6.6%) shrug off this week's downgrade from Goldman Sachs to poke out a gain. Despite many analysts giving the retail chain little chance for a strong turnaround, the large number of top-tier financial institutions with a decent-sized stake in RSH keep some hope alive that a rabbit can be pulled out of the hat.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • ZGNX

    Drug developer Zogenix (ZGNX +4.3%) moves up today after posting a narrower-than-expected Q4...

    Drug developer Zogenix (ZGNX +4.3%) moves up today after posting a narrower-than-expected Q4 loss. Total sales came in at $9.5M, up 12% Y/Y, and consisted solely of net product revenue. Cost of sales was $6M, +20% over the prior-year period. Gross margin soared to 37% compared to 9% in Q411, driven largely by an increase in average net selling prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • STP

    The Suntech (STP +22.3%) roller-coaster takes a turn higher after the nearly insolvent solar...

    The Suntech (STP +22.3%) roller-coaster takes a turn higher after the nearly insolvent solar module maker says it "plans to continue to work" with bondholders even as it states (to no surprise) it "does not plan" to make a principal payment due today. Maxim's Aaron Chew continues to expect a default, but some still expect a bailout from the Wuxi municipal government. LDK Solar (LDK +13.6%) is also winning back some of these week's big losses. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM

  • TherapeuticsMD (TXMD -25%) tanks after pricing its previously announced $50M stock offering at...

    TherapeuticsMD (TXMD -25%) tanks after pricing its previously announced $50M stock offering at $1.70 a share for a total of 29.4M shares. The company's float totals around 99.8M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • SNE

    More on Sony's (SNE +7.5%) rally: An upgrade from Japan's Daiwa Securities is contributing to...

    More on Sony's (SNE +7.5%) rally: An upgrade from Japan's Daiwa Securities is contributing to today's big gains. Also: FCC docs indicate AT&T will soon launch the Xperia ZL, a thicker, less rugged version of the flagship Xperia Z.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +4%) is maintained at Neutral by Goldman Sachs after reporting Q4 results, as the...

    Molycorp (MCP +4%) is maintained at Neutral by Goldman Sachs after reporting Q4 results, as the firm notes positives at MCP despite supply and demand challenges in rare earths this year. MCP's targeted cash production costs of $6-$7/kg is a sign of operational confidence in the near-to-medium term cost roadmap despite recent liquidity and management related turmoil, Goldman says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • OMPI

    Obagi Medical (OMPI +7.7%) moves up today after topping Q4 estimates late yesterday. Looking...

    Obagi Medical (OMPI +7.7%) moves up today after topping Q4 estimates late yesterday. Looking forward, the company sees FY13 earnings of $0.80 to $0.84 per share on $126M to $130M. The Street is at $0.88 per share and $128.31M in revenue. Cantor Fitzgerald upgraded the shares to Buy on the back of the report and raised its price target from $15.00 to $19.00, noting a 50% probability of a takeout in the $21 range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • JPM

    "The workers did it" is becoming the new "I can't recall." Former JPMorgan (JPM -2%)...

    "The workers did it" is becoming the new "I can't recall." Former JPMorgan (JPM -2%) CIO Ina Drew blames traders and managers who reported to her for bets that led to $6B in losses, telling senators that her team changed projected losses and hid information from her. Drew defends her oversight as "reasonable and diligent" and says she shouldn't be held personally responsible for the losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 16 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -1.9%) and AOL (AOL -3.2%), two once-dominant Internet names who have seen big...

    Yahoo (YHOO -1.9%) and AOL (AOL -3.2%), two once-dominant Internet names who have seen big rallies over the last 12 months, are seeing profit-taking today. comScore recently estimated Yahoo's share of the U.S. search market (larger than its global share) fell to 11.6% in February, -50 bps Q/Q and -220 bps Y/Y. Yahoo's weak mobile search position has been taking a toll on its search ops.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD -6.9%) trades lower after reporting largely in-line Q4 results and issuing...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD -6.9%) trades lower after reporting largely in-line Q4 results and issuing soft guidance During the company's earnings call, execs were very vocal that the current quarter is going well. Traffic count was "great" in February and the comparable store sales gain in the first week of March was up 9% despite "gas and the expiration of the payroll tax thing." (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +4.3%) gains this morning after beating Q4 estimates on all counts...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +4.3%) gains this morning after beating Q4 estimates on all counts late yesterday. Total sales increased by 26% Y/Y, driven by development milestone payments earned in the quarter under its collaboration with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY), while its bottom line benefited from a reduction in R&D costs due to lower clinical trial activity in its tavaborole program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • VHC

    More punishment is administered to VirnetX (VHC -8.5%) in response to yesterday's legal defeat....

    More punishment is administered to VirnetX (VHC -8.5%) in response to yesterday's legal defeat. VirnetX has issued a PR noting the Texas jury handling its suit against Cisco did conclude the patent claims asserted by VirnetX were valid (Cisco was claiming prior art), while also concluding Cisco isn't infringing the claims. The company insists yesterday's verdict won't affect its legal victory over Apple. William Blair has dropped coverage of VirnetX; Cowen and Gilford Securities (.pdf) remain bullish.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • CG

    Carlyle (CG -6.6%) files with the SEC to sell 5M shares of its common stock. It appears the...

    Carlyle (CG -6.6%) files with the SEC to sell 5M shares of its common stock. It appears the shares will be offered to the company's employees via benefit or incentive plans.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • T

    Shares of DirecTV (DTV +6%) race higher as investors breathe a sigh of relief that the company...

    Shares of DirecTV (DTV +6%) race higher as investors breathe a sigh of relief that the company won't be buying Vivendi's Brazilian unit. The decision is viewed by some as another sign that management is quite shareholder-friendly.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • RAX

    After opening nearly unchanged, Rackspace (RAX -3.7%) is selling off in the wake of a report IBM...

    After opening nearly unchanged, Rackspace (RAX -3.7%) is selling off in the wake of a report IBM and EMC (among others) are eying rival SoftLayer Technologies. Wells Fargo is arguing SoftLayer competes more with Amazon than Rackspace, and that investors should take the news in stride. But others on the Street are a little more concerned.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +1.7%) rallies as the Street takes the launch of Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy S IV,...

    Apple (AAPL +1.7%) rallies as the Street takes the launch of Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy S IV, which has an impressive spec sheet but has seen mixed early reviews, in stride. Apple's sell-side fans are circling the wagons, with Gene Munster comparing the S IV to an 'S' iPhone launch. Nomura is less sanguine: noting the popularity of bigger displays and stating its checks indicate a bigger iPhone won't arrive in 2013, it thinks Samsung could overtake Apple in high-end smartphone shipments this year on the back of 35M-40M S IV and Note sales per quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 34 Comments
  • ARMH

    An upgrade to Buy from Jefferies sends ARM (ARMH +2.9%) to $43. Jefferies' move follows a string...

    An upgrade to Buy from Jefferies sends ARM (ARMH +2.9%) to $43. Jefferies' move follows a string of January downgrades that failed to halt the CPU core giant's rise. ARM now trades at 38x 2014E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 5 Comments
  • RCL

    A disappointing outlook for profits from Carnival as well as yet more cruise liner problems on...

    A disappointing outlook for profits from Carnival as well as yet more cruise liner problems on the open water are spilling over to taint sector peers. Royal Caribbean (RCL -2%) and Norwegian Cruise Holdings (NCLH -1.3%). are both weak on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival (CCL -5.2%) sputter as the company sets full-year profit guidance below the...

    Shares of Carnival (CCL -5.2%) sputter as the company sets full-year profit guidance below the consensus estimate of analysts. The cruise line operator says it took a $0.02 per share hit to results in Q4 due to voyage disruptions and related repair costs. On the current quarter: "Cumulative advance bookings for 2013 are behind the prior year at prices in line with the prior year levels."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.06. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.06. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) agrees to acquire Permian Basin assets from Comstock Resources...

    Rosetta Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) agrees to acquire Permian Basin assets from Comstock Resources (NYSE:CRK) for ~$768M. ROSE says the deal provides new entry in the Permian and access to oil-weighted multi-pay areas, and expands capital project inventory by ~1,300 gross drilling locations. CRK, +6.5% premarket, updates its 2013 capital budget to $422M to reflect the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ARO

    Digging into Aeropostale's (NYSE:ARO) results: The company's online business only staved off a...

    Digging into Aeropostale's (NYSE:ARO) results: The company's online business only staved off a single percentage point of the retailer's overall 8% drop in comparable store sales in Q4. E-commerce growth was especially poor considering the new GoJane business was lumped into the total. ARO -7.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • CNP

    Premarket gainers: CNP +10%. SNE +8%. ZGNX +6%. OGE +6%. PANL +5%.Losers: GLDD -22%. ULTA -14%....

    Premarket gainers: CNP +10%. SNE +8%. ZGNX +6%. OGE +6%. PANL +5%.
    Losers: GLDD -22%. ULTA -14%. STEC -13%. ARO -7%. VHC -6%. CG -6%. KKD -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) +5.2% after Goldman sings the company's praises in the wake of...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) +5.2% after Goldman sings the company's praises in the wake of Samsung's Galaxy S IV launch. The firm thinks PANL's revenue opportunity with the S IV, which (as expected) sports a 5" 1080p OLED display using green host materials, could be 3x-4x greater than its opportunity with the S III. It might also help that initial S IV reviews generally praise the phone's display, though not everything else about it.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 5 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) gets a boost as Legg Mason's Bill Miller calls the opportunity a...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) gets a boost as Legg Mason's Bill Miller calls the opportunity a "tremendous" one for investors. GRPN +5.5% premarket to $5.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • ASTC

    Astrotech (NASDAQ:ASTC) +6.8% premarket on news its Space Operations subsidiary is awarded a...

    Astrotech (NASDAQ:ASTC) +6.8% premarket on news its Space Operations subsidiary is awarded a NASA task order contract to provide payload processing services for the Soil Moisture Active Passive satellite at its Vandenberg Air Force Base, Calif., facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • SNE

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) rip 7.5% higher in premarket action after its new Android smartphone...

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) rip 7.5% higher in premarket action after its new Android smartphone closes out the week as the top-selling product for the fourth straight week. The company also got a boost from Daiwa Securities with an upgrade to Buy from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM

  • Chinese automaker BYD denies reports it plans to float HK$3.85B ($496M) worth of new stock....

    Chinese automaker BYD denies reports it plans to float HK$3.85B ($496M) worth of new stock. Shares of the company fell 8% in Hong Kong trading earlier today off the chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
  • ULTA

    Credit Suisse upgrades Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) to an Outperform rating despite the retailer's...

    Credit Suisse upgrades Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) to an Outperform rating despite the retailer's disappointing Q1 guidance. A price target of $105 is lined up by the investment firm. ULTA -11.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
  • FCX

    Goldman Sachs upgrades Freeport McMoran (NYSE:FCX) to a Buy rating and raises its price target...

    Goldman Sachs upgrades Freeport McMoran (NYSE:FCX) to a Buy rating and raises its price target to $42. The firm stands more positive on copper and sees the M&A overhang on Freeport diminishing. FCX +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 AM | 1 Comment

  • European shares are mostly flat-to-lower as EU leaders meet for a second day; stocks may be...

    European shares are mostly flat-to-lower as EU leaders meet for a second day; stocks may be affected by the expiration of futures and options contracts. EU Stoxx 50 -0.2%, London flat, Paris -0.3%. Frankfurt flat, Milan +0.2%, Madrid -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed, with shares in Japan boosted by the parliamentary confirmation of the...

    Asian shares are mixed, with shares in Japan boosted by the parliamentary confirmation of the Bank of Japan's new leadership and those in China benefiting from the orderly transfer of power. However, a 2.2% fall in Samsung's shares dragged down Korean shares. Japan +1.4%, Hong Kong -0.4%, China +0.4%, India -0.5%, Korea -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 AM
